alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 10 at 8:15AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Flooding is occurring at Roaring River State Park in the lower campgrounds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Flat Creek at Highway C, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110 and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Cassville, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Pineville, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Roaring River State Park, Anderson, Merriam Woods, Goodman, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Rockaway Beach, Exeter, Wheaton, Indian Point, Branson West, Washburn, Lanagan, Shell Knob, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Butterfield, Mccord Bend, Golden, Table Rock, Emerald Beach, Kirbyville, Eagle Rock, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Coney Island, Jenkins, Cape Fair, Lampe, Powell and Edgewater Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
